body:
The Royal Wedding. [The Royal Series]

May 19, 2018.

..


Every movement led up to this one. The preparations, the stress, the rehearsals, the pep talk, all of it.

Every night of your brother telling you about this “incredible woman named Meghan” led up to him standing in front of the mirror with your hands on his shoulders as he breathed out, nervous but ready to marry the love of his life,

“Are you ready?”

He nodded, smiling at you through the mirror before letting out a chuckle, “I am. I’m ready.”

The moments of you listening to your brothers talk to you about the women they love in their lives and you pestering them with questions about the feeling you had only ever read about, led to you sitting beside your father, sneaking glances at Harry who sat at the front with other friends, his eyes always already set on you.

“You really need to leave.” You giggled as Harry peppered your face with kisses as you both stood hidden behind a wall before you left with Meghan.

“I will, I will,” Harry said absentmindedly, smiling down at you, “Missed you all day.”

“I missed you, too,” You smiled, “Meghan is so nervous. Poor woman listed all possibilities of anything going wrong in under a minute when I asked her if she was okay.”

“She is getting her wedding very publicly viewed,” Harry shrugged, “I can imagine some of her thoughts. But,”

“But,” You repeated as you stressed on the word, wrapping your arms around his neck.

“But her and your brother are in love with each other like mad so no matter what, it’ll be worth it at the end.”

“Ahh,” You chuckled, throwing your head back a little and closing your eyes, “The words of a songwriter.”

“Oh hush,” Harry nudged your forehead with his, “I should go.”

“So should I.” You replied, leaning up to peck his lips, “I’ll see you in a bit.”

“See you in a bit, Princess.” He teased, leaning down to press his lips to yours in kiss.


And when you walked inside the chapel, holding Charlotte’s hand as you walked behind Meghan and your bouquet of flowers with the other, a wide grin on your face as your eyes fell on your brother who stood waiting for his bride before you glanced at William who gave you a smile and a discreet nod of support. But God, when you saw Harry standing along everyone else who had their eyes on Meghan, his on you, you knew it. You knew all about the love you heard about.

With his eyes on you, a smile on his face as he gave you a quick thumbs up which made you giggle and look down at the ground as you walked, looking back at him to see him grinning with his eyebrows raised at you, “Beautiful.” He mouthed.

You helped Charlotte go up the step, stealing one last look at Harry before linking arms with your father after he walked Meghan to your brother, walking with him towards your seat as you listened to the melodies, smoothening down your dress before looking at your brother and his to-be wife as you stood.

“He looks happy.” Your father leaned towards you to whisper. You looked at him with a smile and nodded, looking back at your brother.

When the harmonies were nearing an end, you looked behind you at your grandmother who instantly looked down at you, mirroring your grin quickly before giving you a nod and looking back at Harry.

“God is love, and those who live in love live in God and God lives in them.”

You sat down, having a clear look at Harry who sat on the opposite side of you beside Serena Williams, looking at your brother and Meghan.

As you all stood to sing the Lord of All Hopefulness, you felt Harry’s eyes on you as you both began singing, Harry smirking as he did as he looked at you with his head tilted. You caught yourself mid giggle, looking back down at your book.

As you all finished the hymn, everyone’s eyes were on the couple as the archbishop spoke.

“Harry, will you take Meghan to be your wife? Will you love her, comfort her, honour and protect her, and, forsaking all others, be faithful to her as long as you both shall live?”

At this point, you were shamelessly letting your tears run as you grinned, watching you brother respond, “I will.”

“Meghan, will you take Harry to be your husband? Will you love him, comfort him, honour and protect him, and, forsaking all others, be faithful to him as long as you both shall live?”

“I will.”

“Oh God.” You whispered under your breath as you sniffled, wiping your tears.

“Will you, the families and friends of Harry and Meghan, support and uphold them in their marriage now and in the years to come?”

Your eyes were set on your boyfriend of 6 months as you all replied, “We will.”


//


Your hands were around Harry’s arm as you waved to the public in your evening dress, well aware of the fact that you were confirming your relationship as Harry stood beside you in his burgundy suit. He closed the passenger seat door, his hand moving to be placed on your back as yours mirrored his but wrapped your arm around his waist, looking down at your dress.

“I think it’s stuck in my heel.” You said, looking down at it and moving your foot to find it wrapped around the heel.

Being himself, Harry kneeled down, took your dress away from your heel and smoothened the dress for you before standing back up, “Alright?”

You hummed and nodded, smiling as you gave him a quick peck on his lips, “Thank you.”

His smile sufficed as a reply, tugging you closer to himself as you began walking towards Frogmore House among other guests who definitely eyed you and Harry together. “I think everyone might be staring too much because of how breathtaking you look right now.” Harry leaned closer, whispering in your ear as his eyes remained on the gates.

He was aware of the blush on your face and the small giggle you stifled, despite you rolling your eyes jokingly at him and looking away, “I mean it!”

“You’re such a sap.” You teased him, bumping your hip with his before waving to someone who waved at you.

“For youuuuuu.” Harry nuzzled his face in your cheek, making you let out a small squeal before swatting his chest as you laughed.


//


You cleared your throat as you were standing, everyone’s eyes on you with smiles on their faces and eagerness, waiting for your speech that everyone just knew would have them tearing up.

You looked at your brother and his wife, “It honestly feels like just yesterday Har was telling me about this incredible woman he met. I was so excited for him,” You chuckled, “It might sound cliché but he already looked in love to me and I knew, in that moment, how much of a wonderful woman Meghan was.

When I met Meghan, I knew why my brother was completely head over heels for her. She’s smart, absolutely intelligent and so beautiful and it didn’t take long for me to feel proud of Har.

And when I think about Har getting married, it makes me feel so old. I remember the good old rebellion days,” You chuckled as everyone laughed knowingly, your brother hiding his face in his hands as he laughed, “You went through some tragically cool days.

Harry, thank you for always being there for me. For being someone I can always go to, no matter how much you annoy me sometimes.

Meghan, thank you for somehow agreeing to marry him,” You joked as you cringed, “And welcome to the family. To Harry and Meghan.” You raised your glass up, grinning as everyone repeated in unison.

“You’re making me cry, Tiny!” Your brother shouted before laughing as he wiped his cheek before giving you a smile and putting one hand to his heart, “Thank you. I love you.” He mouthed.

You felt Harry’s arm around your waist, making you lean on him as he wrapped both arms around you, “That was beautiful.”

You looked at him with a bashful smile, slightly tipsy, “Why thank you.”


//


As everyone got on their feet to dance again, that was Harry’s cue to hold your hand and drag you out of your seat, tugging you closer towards where everyone was letting loose, “Come on now!” Harry grinned as he turned to look at you, holding your hands as he reached back before pulling you closer to him. It wasn’t a secret that most people were drunk, Harry included as he danced with Eddie and Emma before pulling you closer to him, slow dancing to the upbeat song. Your hands were around his neck, letting him guide you through the swaying without caring about the song.

Harry’s arms were around your waist, face nuzzled in your neck as your hands moved to his hair. He pressed a kiss to your neck before lifting his head up, slowly kissing your cheek, “You look so fucking beautiful right now and-“

Harry closed his eyes, moving to peck your lips before pulling away, only to kiss you again and again, “And I’m so fucking in love with you.”


//


You couldn’t get drunk after that. You couldn’t risk not remembering that moment. With Harry sleeping peacefully in your bed, his head leaning on yours and his arm around you, the sun coming up wasn’t enough to get you to sleep nor wipe the smile off your face as you played with his hair. You didn’t say it back. It wasn’t that it wasn’t mutual — it was. God, it definitely was. But you couldn’t do it like that, not when he was drunk or asleep.

When you managed to get some sleep, waking up at 11 to Harry coming out of the bathroom arms above his head as he clipped back his hair with one of your clips, a grin making its way on his face once he caught sight of your eyes. “Good morning, Smalls.”

“You know that was a zombie’s name in some movie, right?” You asked sleepily as you stretched in bed.

“You also know I call you that because you’re simply small, right?” Harry teased back, coming to lie on your bed and kissing your cheek, “Thank you for leaving Advil beside me.”

You hummed, giving his scalp a quick scratch before getting up, “No problem, H,” You walked inside your bathroom before closing the door to do your business, opening it once you were brushing your teeth to find Harry outside, “You were very drunk last night,” You managed to say with foam in your mouth, “Said some stuff.” You hinted, rinsing your mouth.

“Yeah?” Harry smirked, leaning on the door, “What did I say?”

You shrugged as you put your facial wash, massaging your face with it, “I don’t know. Just- Some stuff. You know,” You washed your face before looking at him as you dried your hands in a towel, “Drunk stuff.”

“Like what?” He asked, watching you put your hair up in a ponytail, “Because I remember telling you that I’m so fucking in love with you.” At your movement halting, Harry straightened himself from his posture, approaching you. “I remember that.”

You tried to contain your grin as you blushed, looking at him through the mirror before turning, Harry wrapping his arms around your shoulders as you leaned your chin on his chest, “Do you now?”

He hummed, letting his hands fall to your back, “I do. I remember it.”

“It? What’s it?” You asked gently with a smile, wrapping your arms around his waist, “What do you remember?”

“I remember,” Harry’s voice went low and gentle as he spoke slowly, “Telling you,” He raised an eyebrow before swaying the both of you in your place, “I’m in love with you.”

If anything, Harry fell more in love when you giggled and hid your face in his chest, tightening your grasp on him, “Oh God.”

He laughed, throwing his head back, “Come ooooon, look at me.”

You looked up at him, moving your hands to cup his face and squishing his cheeks together which you really wished was photographed in that moment, “And I’m in love with you, Styles.”


//


w e l l how fucking cliché and fluff-dripping was this?

The Royal Wedding. [The Royal Series]

May 19, 2018.

..


Every movement led up to this one. The preparations, the stress, the rehearsals, the pep talk, all of it.

Every night of your brother telling you about this “incredible woman named Meghan” led up to him standing in front of the mirror with your hands on his shoulders as he breathed out, nervous but ready to marry the love of his life,

“Are you ready?”

He nodded, smiling at you through the mirror before letting out a chuckle, “I am. I’m ready.”

The moments of you listening to your brothers talk to you about the women they love in their lives and you pestering them with questions about the feeling you had only ever read about, led to you sitting beside your father, sneaking glances at Harry who sat at the front with other friends, his eyes always already set on you.

“You really need to leave.” You giggled as Harry peppered your face with kisses as you both stood hidden behind a wall before you left with Meghan.

“I will, I will,” Harry said absentmindedly, smiling down at you, “Missed you all day.”

“I missed you, too,” You smiled, “Meghan is so nervous. Poor woman listed all possibilities of anything going wrong in under a minute when I asked her if she was okay.”

“She is getting her wedding very publicly viewed,” Harry shrugged, “I can imagine some of her thoughts. But,”

“But,” You repeated as you stressed on the word, wrapping your arms around his neck.

“But her and your brother are in love with each other like mad so no matter what, it’ll be worth it at the end.”

“Ahh,” You chuckled, throwing your head back a little and closing your eyes, “The words of a songwriter.”

“Oh hush,” Harry nudged your forehead with his, “I should go.”

“So should I.” You replied, leaning up to peck his lips, “I’ll see you in a bit.”

“See you in a bit, Princess.” He teased, leaning down to press his lips to yours in kiss.


And when you walked inside the chapel, holding Charlotte’s hand as you walked behind Meghan and your bouquet of flowers with the other, a wide grin on your face as your eyes fell on your brother who stood waiting for his bride before you glanced at William who gave you a smile and a discreet nod of support. But God, when you saw Harry standing along everyone else who had their eyes on Meghan, his on you, you knew it. You knew all about the love you heard about.

With his eyes on you, a smile on his face as he gave you a quick thumbs up which made you giggle and look down at the ground as you walked, looking back at him to see him grinning with his eyebrows raised at you, “Beautiful.” He mouthed.

You helped Charlotte go up the step, stealing one last look at Harry before linking arms with your father after he walked Meghan to your brother, walking with him towards your seat as you listened to the melodies, smoothening down your dress before looking at your brother and his to-be wife as you stood.

“He looks happy.” Your father leaned towards you to whisper. You looked at him with a smile and nodded, looking back at your brother.

When the harmonies were nearing an end, you looked behind you at your grandmother who instantly looked down at you, mirroring your grin quickly before giving you a nod and looking back at Harry.

“God is love, and those who live in love live in God and God lives in them.”

You sat down, having a clear look at Harry who sat on the opposite side of you beside Serena Williams, looking at your brother and Meghan.

As you all stood to sing the Lord of All Hopefulness, you felt Harry’s eyes on you as you both began singing, Harry smirking as he did as he looked at you with his head tilted. You caught yourself mid giggle, looking back down at your book.

As you all finished the hymn, everyone’s eyes were on the couple as the archbishop spoke.

“Harry, will you take Meghan to be your wife? Will you love her, comfort her, honour and protect her, and, forsaking all others, be faithful to her as long as you both shall live?”

At this point, you were shamelessly letting your tears run as you grinned, watching you brother respond, “I will.”

“Meghan, will you take Harry to be your husband? Will you love him, comfort him, honour and protect him, and, forsaking all others, be faithful to him as long as you both shall live?”

“I will.”

“Oh God.” You whispered under your breath as you sniffled, wiping your tears.

“Will you, the families and friends of Harry and Meghan, support and uphold them in their marriage now and in the years to come?”

Your eyes were set on your boyfriend of 6 months as you all replied, “We will.”


//


Your hands were around Harry’s arm as you waved to the public in your evening dress, well aware of the fact that you were confirming your relationship as Harry stood beside you in his burgundy suit. He closed the passenger seat door, his hand moving to be placed on your back as yours mirrored his but wrapped your arm around his waist, looking down at your dress.

“I think it’s stuck in my heel.” You said, looking down at it and moving your foot to find it wrapped around the heel.

Being himself, Harry kneeled down, took your dress away from your heel and smoothened the dress for you before standing back up, “Alright?”

You hummed and nodded, smiling as you gave him a quick peck on his lips, “Thank you.”

His smile sufficed as a reply, tugging you closer to himself as you began walking towards Frogmore House among other guests who definitely eyed you and Harry together. “I think everyone might be staring too much because of how breathtaking you look right now.” Harry leaned closer, whispering in your ear as his eyes remained on the gates.

He was aware of the blush on your face and the small giggle you stifled, despite you rolling your eyes jokingly at him and looking away, “I mean it!”

“You’re such a sap.” You teased him, bumping your hip with his before waving to someone who waved at you.

“For youuuuuu.” Harry nuzzled his face in your cheek, making you let out a small squeal before swatting his chest as you laughed.


//


You cleared your throat as you were standing, everyone’s eyes on you with smiles on their faces and eagerness, waiting for your speech that everyone just knew would have them tearing up.

You looked at your brother and his wife, “It honestly feels like just yesterday Har was telling me about this incredible woman he met. I was so excited for him,” You chuckled, “It might sound cliché but he already looked in love to me and I knew, in that moment, how much of a wonderful woman Meghan was.

When I met Meghan, I knew why my brother was completely head over heels for her. She’s smart, absolutely intelligent and so beautiful and it didn’t take long for me to feel proud of Har.

And when I think about Har getting married, it makes me feel so old. I remember the good old rebellion days,” You chuckled as everyone laughed knowingly, your brother hiding his face in his hands as he laughed, “You went through some tragically cool days.

Harry, thank you for always being there for me. For being someone I can always go to, no matter how much you annoy me sometimes.

You felt Harry’s arm around your waist, making you lean on him as he wrapped both arms around you, “That was beautiful.”

You looked at him with a bashful smile, slightly tipsy, “Why thank you.”

As everyone got on their feet to dance again, that was Harry’s cue to hold your hand and drag you out of your seat, tugging you closer towards where everyone was letting loose, “Come on now!” Harry grinned as he turned to look at you, holding your hands as he reached back before pulling you closer to him. It wasn’t a secret that most people were drunk, Harry included as he danced with Eddie and Emma before pulling you closer to him, slow dancing to the upbeat song. Your hands were around his neck, letting him guide you through the swaying without caring about the song.

Harry’s arms were around your waist, face nuzzled in your neck as your hands moved to his hair. He pressed a kiss to your neck before lifting his head up, slowly kissing your cheek, “You look so fucking beautiful right now and-“

Harry closed his eyes, moving to peck your lips before pulling away, only to kiss you again and again, “And I’m so fucking in love with you.”

You couldn’t get drunk after that. You couldn’t risk not remembering that moment. With Harry sleeping peacefully in your bed, his head leaning on yours and his arm around you, the sun coming up wasn’t enough to get you to sleep nor wipe the smile off your face as you played with his hair. You didn’t say it back. It wasn’t that it wasn’t mutual — it was. God, it definitely was. But you couldn’t do it like that, not when he was drunk or asleep.

When you managed to get some sleep, waking up at 11 to Harry coming out of the bathroom arms above his head as he clipped back his hair with one of your clips, a grin making its way on his face once he caught sight of your eyes. “Good morning, Smalls.”

“You know that was a zombie’s name in some movie, right?” You asked sleepily as you stretched in bed.

“You also know I call you that because you’re simply small, right?” Harry teased back, coming to lie on your bed and kissing your cheek, “Thank you for leaving Advil beside me.”

um hii?? wow i’m a terrible human being for neglecting this blog so badly. i know i promised on more than one occasion that i’d be back but it never happened and for that i’m so sorry. i guess i just don’t have the motivation for doing texts anymore and that makes me kind of sad because i really loved doing them when i started it.

right now i’m here to promote my new book on wattpad, not that anyone stayed here and waited for a potential update. or maybe if you are here then thank you! that’s very sweet :)

so baso . i started a new book a few days ago, maybe a week and it’s called hidden secrets! it’s by far the most organised and collected and well written story i have ever published and i enjoy writing it very much!! there’s only a few chapters up when i’m making this post so if you wish to check it out i’m gonna link it now!

this is the cover and what you should look for:

again, i’m sorry for fucking off just like that. i hope you guys are not too mad at me for it and if you are then there’s not much i can do. i definitely don’t want to force myself to do anything i don’t enjoy because it’ll turn out like a pile of shit and that’ll just make me frustrated and sad. i don’t wanna give out somet i’m not happy with yano 😌
